summary: The diff adds documentation and automated slug-validation checks (a Node validation script and a GitHub Actions workflow) to ensure the production slug equals "galfashionworld-2014". However, it does not provide evidence of an actual production/public publish workflow being executed or configured to make the deployment publicly accessible/live.

missing_requirements.requirement: Proceed with the production/public publish workflow to make the currently deployed Gal Fashion World single-page website fully public/live using production slug "galfashionworld-2014".
missing_requirements.reason: The changes add validation/guardrails and a deployment guide, but the diff summary does not show any implementation or configuration of a production/public publish workflow (e.g., deployment pipeline/job, publish command integration, or hosting platform configuration) that would actually perform the public/live publish and ensure the resulting deployment is publicly accessible.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a GitHub Actions CI workflow that runs on pushes/PRs to validate the production slug and print a readiness summary.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-19 asks to proceed with the production/public publish workflow itself (making the site live/public). Adding CI validation is not explicitly requested as part of that requirement, and the diff does not show it being required by the BuildRequest.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced a standalone Node.js script to validate frontend/domain-slug.json contents against the expected slug.
hallucinated_features.reason: While helpful for preventing slug validation errors, a new validation script is not explicitly requested by REQ-19; the request is to perform/enable the public publish workflow using the correct slug.
